@arrufat : Thanks for the suggestion. This would be useful for building packaged distributions. Feel free to send a pull request adding your script and we can discuss further there. I would suggest explicitly taking the version as an argument instead of using grep over RELEASE.md and maybe an appropriate location for this script would be tensorflow/c/generate-pc.sh.

FYI, on OS X using homebrew, @kali and @ilovezfs have been kind enough to make installation as simple as brew install libtensorflow that includes the pkg-config

body:
@arrufat : Thanks for the suggestion. This would be useful for building packaged distributions. Feel free to send a pull request adding your script and we can discuss further there. I would suggest explicitly taking the version as an argument instead of using `grep` over `RELEASE.md` and maybe an appropriate location for this script would be `tensorflow/c/generate-pc.sh`.

FYI, on OS X using [homebrew](https://brew.sh/), @kali and @ilovezfs have been kind enough to make installation as simple as `brew install libtensorflow` that [includes the pkg-config](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/blob/master/Formula/libtensorflow.rb)
